eu.cqse.check.framework.core

Class CheckImplementationBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.core.CheckImplementationBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommentCheckBase, EntityCheckBase, HardCodedLiteralsCheckBase, TopLevelTypeCheckBase

    public abstract class CheckImplementationBase
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract base class for custom checks. A check is instantiated () and initialized with a check context when its executing processor is set up (CheckProcessor.initializeChecks()) based on CheckInfo Objects. It is destroyed, when the executing processor has finished execution.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected ICheckContext context
      The check context that is used to access custom check specific functionality.

      • context

        protected ICheckContext context
        The check context that is used to access custom check specific functionality.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CheckImplementationBase

        public CheckImplementationBase()

    • Method Detail

      • setContext

        public void setContext(ICheckContext context)
        Sets the context. Must not be called if the context has already been set.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws CheckException
        Initializes the custom check. This is called after the parameters have been set, but before the check is executed and before the context is set. This method is called only once for a batch of files that need to be analyzed. Since the context is file-specific it can't be accessed here. This method is intended for preprocessing or parsing of the parameters.
        Throws:
        CheckException - can be thrown by subclasses

      • execute

        public abstract void execute()
                      throws CheckException
        Executes the custom check with the given context.
        Throws:
        CheckException

      • getCodeViewOption

        protected ECodeViewOption getCodeViewOption()
        Can be used to specifiy the code representation. See ECodeViewOption for details, the default is ECodeViewOption.FILTERED. See the Teamscale Code Processing Pipeline

      • select

        protected java.util.List<ShallowEntity> select(java.lang.String xPathExpression)
                                        throws CheckException
        Selects all shallow entities from the abstract syntax tree, that match the given xpath-expression. Set CodeViewOption via overwriting getCodeViewOption(). This method can be used, if the executing check requests the ECheckParameter.ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_TREE parameter.
        Throws:
        CheckException

      • selectUnfilteredPreProcessed

        protected java.util.List<ShallowEntity> selectUnfilteredPreProcessed(java.lang.String xPathExpression)
                                                              throws CheckException
        Selects all shallow entities from the abstract syntax tree, that match the given xpath-expression. Code representation is ECodeViewOption.UNFILTERED_PREPROCESSED.
        Throws:
        CheckException

      • createSelectionPattern

        protected static java.lang.String createSelectionPattern(EShallowEntityType entityType,
                                                         java.lang.String... subtypeAlternatives)
        Creates a xpath-expression to select entities with the given type and the optional subtype alternatives eg. "//METHOD[subtype('function') | subtype('function declaration')]".

      • select

        public static java.util.List<ShallowEntity> select(ShallowEntity entity,
                                                   java.lang.String xPathExpression)
                                            throws CheckException
        Selects all shallow entities starting from the given entity, that match the given xpath-expression. This method is still selecting entities from the whole AST as long as the xPath expression does not limit the selection to a special axis. For more information have a look at http://www.w3schools.com/xsl/xpath_syntax.asp
        Throws:
        CheckException

      • createFinding

        protected void createFinding(java.lang.String message)
                      throws CheckException
        Creates a finding with the given message for the whole analyzed token element.
        Throws:
        CheckException

      • createFinding

        protected void createFinding(java.lang.String message,
                             IToken token)
                      throws CheckException
        Creates a finding with the given message at the given token. Use this method, if the token is determined from ICheckContext#getTextContent() or another method that is based on filtered content.
        Throws:
        CheckException

      • createFinding

        protected void createFinding(java.lang.String message,
                             IToken startToken,
                             IToken endToken)
                      throws CheckException

        Throws:
        CheckException

                                             IToken startToken,
                                             IToken endToken)
                                      throws CheckException
        Creates a finding with the given message beginning from startToken to endToken. Use this method, if the tokens are determined from ICheckContext#getUnfilteredTextContent() or another method that is based on unfiltered content.

      • createFindingForSiblings

        protected void createFindingForSiblings(java.lang.String message,
                                        PairList<IToken,IToken> startAndEndTokens)
                                 throws CheckException
        Creates findings with the given message for the given pair lists of start- and end tokens.
        Parameters:
        message - the message describing the findings
        startAndEndTokens - A list of corresponding pairs of start and end tokens.
        Throws:
        CheckException

      • createFindingForSiblingEntities

        protected void createFindingForSiblingEntities(java.lang.String message,
                                               java.util.List<ShallowEntity> associatedEntities)
                                        throws CheckException
        Creates findings for entities which are associated in some way. The entities must stem from the same file.
        Throws:
        CheckException

      • createFinding

        protected void createFinding(java.lang.String message,
                             int startLine,
                             int endLine)
                      throws CheckException
        Creates a finding with the given message from the given start line (inclusive) to the given end line (inclusive). Use this method, if the lines are determined from ICheckContext#getTextContent() or another method that is based on filtered content.
        Throws:
        CheckException

      • createInstance

        public static CheckImplementationBase createInstance(java.lang.Class<?> checkClass)
                                              throws CheckException
        Creates an instance of the given check class.
        Throws:
        CheckException

      • isCpp

        public boolean isCpp()
              throws CheckException
        Determines if the the check is currently processing source code that is written in C++ based on the file extension and the C++ specific tokens. Especially distinguishes C++ from C source code.
        Returns:
        true if the context is C++, false else
        Throws:
        CheckException
